pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUpon Updated - Mutilated Male Body Found In NorthPhiladelphia© 2003 by Linda Moulton Howe March 4, 2003 - Update - Philadelphia police now say that Willie Kent did notdie where his body was found and that his heart, a lung and his liver wereremoved at another location. Further, one investigator now says that the cutfrom Mr. Kent's neck to the base of his stomach was "very crudely done."Authorities still do not know whether to classify the mutilated man's body as ahomicide or abuse of a corpse after death.Another development is a possible connection between a slash wound on Mr.Kent's neck and a stab wound in the neck of murdered and homeless64-year-old Alva Figueroa discovered January 28 only four blocks from whereWillie Kent's mutilated body was found on February 28, 2003. March 3, 2003 - Update - The 60-year-old mutilation victim has now beenidentified as Willie Kent. A spokesman for the Philadelphia Medical Examiner'sOffice, Jeff Moran, will not yet answer questions about the autopsy and said itcould take six to eight weeks to complete the examination. March 2, 2003 Philadelphia, Pennsylvania - On Friday, February 28, 2003, aman's body was found in an abandoned North Philadelphia rowhouse. Ira Porterof The Philadelphia Inquirer reported, "The body was found face down about2:30 p.m. inside the first-floor back room of a trash-filled rowhouse on the 1500block of North Eighth Street, according to police. Police responding to thescene at first believed that the death might have been due to natural causes, butan on-site inspection by the Medical Examiner's Office revealed that was not thecase. ... The man's body had been neatly sliced from the bottom of his neck tothe base of his stomach." The organs that were neatly removed were his heart,liver and one of his lungs. So far, neither the police nor the coroner are certain ifthe man died at the scene or had been mutilated elsewhere and then dumped inthe rowhouse.Over the weekend, the Philadelphia Medical Examiner's Office "tentativelyidentified the man's identity" pending notification of his family. The man isdescribed as black, 5-foot-7 and between 30 to 40 years old. He was wearingblue jeans, a fatigue jacket and a sweatshirt. Police said a rope was found aroundhis neck and his face was frozen. Time of death, the police speculate, wasaround Thursday or Wednesday, one or two days before the body was found bya Philadelphia resident looking for metal scrap.Since the 1500 block of North Eighth Street in downtown Philadelphia isnotorious for drug addicts, Homicide Capt. Charles Bloom said, "We thoughtthis was a drug overdose or a homeless person. It was not until they lifted thebody up that they saw he was missing some organs."The Philadelphia Police Department's Homicide Division has given out a phonenumber to call if anyone has information: 215-686-3334.
